Body:
I asked a previous question related to this one about parts of speech. I need to figure out what a determiner (DT) is in Penn Treebank Tag Set. In the set examples found in the tag set, it appears that a determiner is a mixture of articles and adjectives. For my purposes articles and adjectives need to be separated.

Is a determiner in the Penn Treebank Tag Set considered just articles or a mixture of articles and adjectives?
Title: What is a determiner?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I am a software developer, who also happens to have a great many other interests in life. One of them is linguistics (and languages in general). My native language is Portuguese and, at the moment, I'm commited to the Portuguese Language & Usage proposal. If you love that language and admire its tradition as much as I do, please commit to it and be part of a great lusophone community!

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I am a Literacy PhD student at the University at Buffalo.
